text:
Raskolnikov's Dilemma

Dim room, Raskolnikov dazed, Razumihin eager.  
“Thirty-five roubles for you, from Vahrushin.”  
“Vahrushin… I remember,” Raskolnikov murmurs.  
“See? He’s coherent! Intelligent man!” Razumihin beams.  

---  

Tension rises, Razumihin holds a pen.  
“Just sign, Rodya! Money is sweet!”  
“I don’t want it,” Raskolnikov pushes it away.  
“Not want it?” Razumihin gasps.  
“I won’t sign it.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov refuses to sign for a remittance of thirty-five roubles sent by his mother, indicating his disconnection from his circumstances.
